Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2015 10:06AM molly1976 wrote: My MO said a glass of wine, and even encouraged it. I only recently started allowing myself the occasional drink, though, since alcohol raises estrogen levels and my tumor was so strongly ER+. I don't think I will ever feel comfortable drinking at the levels I did pre-diagnosis (which was still very moderate compared with most people).
Posts.Title: Alcohol and Chemotherapy tamkay123 BeachMom2018

Posts.Content: May 10, 2015 01:10PM molly1976 wrote: I did weekly taxol only (no AC) and my hair went at about the 3 week mark. I didn't lose all of it, though - I shaved it off when it started to fall out and have had a thin stubble ever since. Some of it is growing a little. I'm definitely mostly bald, though.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2015 07:00PM molly1976 wrote: I'm 12 weeks PFC and finally almost have my whole scalp covered. It took a good 8 weeks to get going but since then is growing fast! I do wonder how much Herceptin has slowed it, though. My MO seemed surprised that I was still bald 8 weeks out.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2016 09:21PM molly1976 wrote: Nope, I've never had curly hair in my life! I have no idea what to do with it. Fortunately my hairstylist has curly hair too and she recommended some products to keep it un-frizzy. I do think it's already starting to relax a little bit, about six months after the regrowth started.

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2016 08:11PM - edited Jan 28, 2016 08:11PM by molly1976 Hi guys, I'm eight months PFC today and I think really in the past couple of weeks I genuinely look like I did this to my hair on purpose. Hang in there!

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2017 02:26PM molly1976 wrote: Hi Daniell, I shaved my head on the day of weekly Taxol #4. It had been falling out a bit before then, but I went to the bathroom while I was getting the infusion and noticed the whole back of my sweater was covered in hair, so I didn't really have a choice at that point. The good news is - this is my hair today. :) I finished chemo on May 27, 2015.

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2015 12:05PM molly1976 wrote: i am stage 1 with a clear sentinel node and my MO told me it is about 1% of cancers like mine that would spread without having gone through lymph nodes.

Posts.Content: May 18, 2015 11:55PM molly1976 wrote: I do exercise, Trvler, although only walking and yoga - not as intense as what I was doing before diagnosis. But I try to go for 3 mile walks especially on the days when I feel the worst. It does seem to help with fatigue at the very least.
